paragraphs.content: Chapter 3
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 3

paragraphs.content: After this opened Job his mouth, and cursed his day.
paragraphs.contentHtml: After this opened Job his mouth, and cursed his day.

paragraphs.content: And Job spake, and said,
paragraphs.contentHtml: And Job spake, and said,

paragraphs.content: Let the day perish wherein I was born, and the night in which it was said, There is a man child conceived.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let the day perish wherein I was born, and the night in which it was said, There is a man child conceived.

paragraphs.content: Let that day be darkness; let not God regard it from above, neither let the light shine upon it.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let that day be darkness; let not God regard it from above, neither let the light shine upon it.

paragraphs.content: Let darkness and the shadow of death stain it; let a cloud dwell upon it; let the blackness of the day terrify it.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let darkness and the shadow of death stain it; let a cloud dwell upon it; let the blackness of the day terrify it.

paragraphs.content: As for that night, let darkness seize upon it; let it not be joined unto the days of the year, let it not come into the number of the months.
paragraphs.contentHtml: As for that night, let darkness seize upon it; let it not be joined unto the days of the year, let it not come into the number of the months.

paragraphs.content: Lo, let that night be solitary, let no joyful voice come therein.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Lo, let that night be solitary, let no joyful voice come therein.

paragraphs.content: Let them curse it that curse the day, who are ready to raise up their mourning.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let them curse it that curse the day, who are ready to raise up their mourning.

paragraphs.content: Let the stars of the twilight thereof be dark; let it look for light, but have none; neither let it see the dawning of the day:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let the stars of the twilight thereof be dark; let it look for light, but have none; neither let it see the dawning of the day:

paragraphs.content: Because it shut not up the doors of my mother’s womb, nor hid sorrow from mine eyes.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Because it shut not up the doors of my mother’s womb, nor hid sorrow from mine eyes.

paragraphs.content: Why died I not from the womb? why did I not give up the ghost when I came out of the belly?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Why died I not from the womb? why did I not give up the ghost when I came out of the belly?

paragraphs.content: Why did the knees prevent me? or why the breasts that I should suck?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Why did the knees prevent me? or why the breasts that I should suck?

paragraphs.content: For now should I have lain still and been quiet, I should have slept: then had I been at rest,
paragraphs.contentHtml: For now should I have lain still and been quiet, I should have slept: then had I been at rest,

paragraphs.content: With kings and counsellors of the earth, which built desolate places for themselves;
paragraphs.contentHtml: With kings and counsellors of the earth, which built desolate places for themselves;

paragraphs.content: Or with princes that had gold, who filled their houses with silver:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Or with princes that had gold, who filled their houses with silver:

paragraphs.content: Or as an hidden untimely birth I had not been; as infants which never saw light.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Or as an hidden untimely birth I had not been; as infants which never saw light.

paragraphs.content: There the wicked cease from troubling; and there the weary be at rest.
paragraphs.contentHtml: There the wicked cease from troubling; and there the weary be at rest.

paragraphs.content: There the prisoners rest together; they hear not the voice of the oppressor.
paragraphs.contentHtml: There the prisoners rest together; they hear not the voice of the oppressor.

paragraphs.content: The small and great are there; and the servant is free from his master.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The small and great are there; and the servant is free from his master.

paragraphs.content: Wherefore is light given to him that is in misery, and life unto the bitter in soul;
paragraphs.contentHtml: Wherefore is light given to him that is in misery, and life unto the bitter in soul;

paragraphs.content: Which long for death, but it cometh not; and dig for it more than for hid treasures;
paragraphs.contentHtml: Which long for death, but it cometh not; and dig for it more than for hid treasures;

paragraphs.content: Which rejoice exceedingly, and are glad, when they can find the grave?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Which rejoice exceedingly, and are glad, when they can find the grave?

paragraphs.content: Why is light given to a man whose way is hid, and whom God hath hedged in?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Why is light given to a man whose way is hid, and whom God hath hedged in?

paragraphs.content: For my sighing cometh before I eat, and my roarings are poured out like the waters.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For my sighing cometh before I eat, and my roarings are poured out like the waters.

paragraphs.content: For the thing which I greatly feared is come upon me, and that which I was afraid of is come unto me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For the thing which I greatly feared is come upon me, and that which I was afraid of is come unto me.

paragraphs.content: I was not in safety, neither had I rest, neither was I quiet; yet trouble came.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I was not in safety, neither had I rest, neither was I quiet; yet trouble came.
